lead_paragraph: Watching the unfolding epidemic and concerned that many people did not grasp what it meant to raise a child with the condition, a Manhattan couple offered to share their experience.

headline.print_headline: A Family’s Struggle With a Birth Defect Now Tied to Zika
headline.main: One Family’s Struggle With Microcephaly, the Birth Defect Now Linked to Zika

snippet: Watching the unfolding epidemic and concerned that many people did not grasp what it meant to raise a child with the condition, a Manhattan couple offered to share their experience....
abstract: Manhattan couple Christine Grounds and Jon Mir have been struggling to care for their son Nicholas, who was born with microcephaly in 2006, years before Zika epidemic brought condition into public consciousness; Nicholas's slow progress, driven by intense and expensive therapy, foreshadows challenges awaiting children with Zika-related birth defects.
